meanings.definition: The quality or state of being detectable.
meanings.sent1: The detectabilities of the hidden object amazed the detective.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the detectabilities of different substances.
meanings.sent3: The detectabilities of the invisible ink made the spy's job easier.
meanings.sent4: The detectabilities of the scent led the bloodhound to the missing child.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the concept of detectabilities using simple examples.

meanings.sent1: The security system's detectabilities were crucial in catching the thief.
meanings.sent2: The camouflage failed due to its detectabilities in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The detectabilities of the prankster's disguise made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The detectabilities of the lie were evident in the suspect's body language.
meanings.sent5: The detective relied on the suspect's detectabilities to solve the case.
